Package net.kuujo.copycat.raft.protocol Description

The protocol layer provides a set of interfaces for communicating between Raft clients and servers in a Raft cluster.

At the core of the protocol layer are the Request and Response interfaces. The protocol provides for all of the internal and client-facing request types necessary to participate in consensus via the Raft consensus protocol.

All Request and Response objects are AlleycatSerializable and ReferenceCounted. This reduces garbage by allowing Alleycat to pool requests and responses during deserialization.

All Requests and Responses provide a custom Builder implementation specific to each request's or response's attributes. Builders can be created by calling the static builder() method on a given Request or Response implementation. Builders are thread local and are not thread safe. All builders assume that they will be completed via Builder.build() in the same thread in which it was created.

Author:
Jordan Halterman
